credentials:
Sports Physio (NZ) Ltd established 1999.
Company Director and Lead Physiotherapist
BHScPhysiotherapy (1998)
Post Graduate Diploma Sports and Exercise Medicine (with distinction) 2012.
description1: Tanya has over 25 years clinical experience in Private practice physiotherapy. She has a holistic approach to Physiotherapy practice, ensuring accurate diagnosis, evidence informed treatment, individualised approach and effective care for all Musculoskeletal and Sports injuries and presentations. Treatment may include hands on/ manual therapy techniques and Exercise Rehabilitation alongside Patient education in self care, injury prevention and recovery.
description2: Tanya is focused on helping patients understand their physical injury/ challenge in a holistic way. Current medical science recognises that physical injuries and pain are influenced by multiple factors including mental health, social, lifestyle, occupation and activity specific factors and loading. Holistic Physiotherapy aims to assist you to not just recover from injury or painful conditions, but to prevent recurrence and enjoy an active lifestyle.

generalInfo.name: ACC Coverage
generalInfo.description: ACC covers injuries sustained following accidental trauma or load, and Claims can be lodged at the clinic by the Physiotherapist. Apply to all services for Non-Accidental injuries, Massage, and Pilates.

generalInfo.name: Accelerated Care Pathways
generalInfo.description: Sports Physio (NZ) Ltd is a contracted supplier under the Careway programme. Several injury types and certain conditions are able to be cared for under an Accelerated care pathway, with no ACC surcharge. ACC has identified key injuries that require an Interdisciplinary approach, with typically longer periods of care with higher frequency of Physiotherapy appointments required for full recovery. Examples include: Knee ACL injuries, some Ankle ligament injuries, certain cervical spine, lumbar spine and shoulder injuries. Please enquire if your injury might be covered under this scheme.

generalInfo.name: Southern Cross Easy Claim
generalInfo.description: Sports Physio (NZ) Ltd is a contracted supplier under the Southern Cross Easy Claim programme. Just let your physio know if you have a Southern Cross policy covering Physiotherapy and we can invoice your insurer directly.

generalInfo.name: Other Insurers
generalInfo.description: We supply high quality Physiotherapy services for all healthcare suppliers. Typically we supply a receipt and you lodge for reimbursement with your Insurer.

services.name: Sports Physio
services.description: Providing comprehensive, effective and accurate Physiotherapy assessment and treatment for all clients regardless of age or level of sporting achievement.

services.name: Sports Rehabilitation
services.description: Sport rehabilitation focuses on understanding, preventing and treating sports and exercise-related injuries and musculoskeletal conditions.

services.name: Pilates
services.description: Pilates is an incredible tool for pain relief, injury prevention, rehabilitation, strengthening, flexibility, core, posture, symmetry, muscle balance and performance.

services.name: ACC Registered Clinic
services.description: Most Sports and musculoskeletal injuries when caused accidentally are covered by ACC insurance legislation in NZ.

services.name: Sports Massage
services.description: Regular sports massage will speed recovery, condition and prepare muscles, free up stiff joints and tight muscles, help prevent injuries and increase movement, flexibility and joint range of movement.

faqs.name: Do I need a doctor’s referral to see a physiotherapist?
faqs.description: No. You can self-refer to physiotherapy without a doctor’s referral. Physiotherapists in NZ are primary care practitioners who can lodge ACC claims, refer for radiology, and refer you to GPs, specialists, or other healthcare providers.

faqs.name: Is Sports Physio (NZ) Ltd ACC registered?
faqs.description: Yes. Sports Physio (NZ) Ltd is an ACC registered provider.

faqs.name: Do you help with private or non-insurance injuries?
faqs.description: Yes. We also treat private and non-insurance-covered musculoskeletal concerns and injuries.

faqs.name: Do you treat more than just sports injuries?
faqs.description: Yes. We assess and treat all injuries including accidents, strains, sprains, painful conditions, headaches, postural issues, occupational injuries, and overuse concerns.

faqs.name: Do you accept healthcare insurance?
faqs.description: Yes. We provide physiotherapy services under all healthcare insurance providers, provided your policy includes physiotherapy coverage.

faqs.name: Can you invoice Southern Cross directly?
faqs.description: Yes. Sports Physio (NZ) Ltd is a Southern Cross Easy-Claim provider. If your policy includes cover for physiotherapy, we can invoice Southern Cross directly.

faqs.name: What is the ICPMSK programme and are you registered?
faqs.description: Yes. Tanya Browne, Principal Physiotherapist, is an ICPMSK registered provider. Some complex injuries may qualify for no-fee physiotherapy under the ACC ICPMSK programme. We are also registered under the Careway programme.

faqs.name: Where are your clinics located?
faqs.description: Our main clinic is located in Parnell: The Convent, Level 1 Suite 4, 218 Parnell Rd, Auckland 1052. We also offer services in Waitakere (by arrangement), home visits, workplace visits, and support for sports teams and events.

faqs.name: What are your professional fees?
faqs.description: Fees vary based on insurance coverage, appointment length, and eligibility for discounts. Please visit www.sportsphysio.co.nz for full details. We offer discounts for students, beneficiaries, and to support equitable healthcare access.

faqs.name: Who is the physiotherapist and what is her experience?
faqs.description: Tanya Browne, Principal Physiotherapist, holds a BHSc in Physiotherapy (1998) and a Postgraduate Diploma in Sports Medicine (2012, with distinction). With over 27 years of experience, Tanya is known for her empathetic care, effective diagnosis, evidence-informed treatment, and 'magic hands'.

faqs.name: What other services do you offer?
faqs.description: We offer Pilates, sports taping, taping workshops, physio sports massage, acupuncture/dry needling, occupational health services, World Rugby medical education, and physiotherapy for sports events and teams.

reviews.name: Nui N Scott McGregor
reviews.review: Tanya has been my physio for the last 6-7 years. She is brilliant. She not only treats my injury, but also works on my strength and flexibility to prevent further injuries. Tanya is friendly, professional and she cares about her patients. Some of my friends and colleagues now use her also, and spoke very highly of their time with her.

reviews.name: Aakash Virdi
reviews.review: Very positive experience from first contact. Tanya was very knowledgeable and gentle. Felt like I saw improvement with my mid back pain after only one day of exercises. Such an immediate relief all because she get to the root cause and fixed it.

reviews.name: Anne Bray
reviews.review: Tanya has been fantastic, she is personable and professional. She has used a variety of techniques to help me recover from knee surgery.
